commenter_a: The supreme court has been and is political. It has jettisoned the straight forward and logical meaning of the Constitution in a growing social activism. The concept of heterosexual marriage has been intact from the beginning of historical time...until the present attempts to normalize the homosexual perversion . Legal liasons by contract have always been possible to all persons but the attempts to socially institutionalize and legally legitimize homosexual marriage as an equal and legitimate alternative to heterosexual marriage will never legitimize it. It may legalize it - but unborn baby murder is legal but will never be morally normal nor moral.
post_message: Rick Santorum thinks that Congress should fight the Supreme Court if the court rules in favor of gay marriage. Is he right or wrong?
